JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: Manager of Group Accounting & Controlling for Unifeeder, Aarhus
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Are you motivated by taking ownership of your tasks, and do you take pride in building and driving efficient controlling as part of an ambitious and talented finance team? Then you get a unique opportunity at Unifeeder to develop and shape the accounting and controlling area in a growing international company.

betterpeople A/S is on behalf of Unifeeder searching for a Manager of Group Accounting & Controlling to the Unifeeder Headquarter.

Career opportunities in a global environment
As a Manager of Group Accounting & Controlling at Unifeeder, you will be part of a finance department with great development potential where you will get professional and skilled colleagues who challenge each other to find the best solutions. Unifeeder has an energetic work environment which includes a dynamic approach and a strong team spirit among colleagues in both Aarhus, Singapore, Dubai, and Limassol.

This large international organization values procedures and structure, but as a result of their growth journey they are open to updating, reassessing, and changing the way they do things. At Unifeeder, you will work close to the management in an organization with short decision paths and good development opportunities. They offer you a flexible and versatile work life filled with development, challenge, and inspiration.

Key role in Unifeeder's finance department
As a Manager of Group Accounting & Controlling, you will ensure the accounting based on materiality and risk in relation to the IFRS rules. You will define and implement standardized processes in Unifeeder worldwide, which is why you will be an important part of defining the standards and setting the direction.

Furthermore, you will drive group wide projects to facilitate a faster and better close and a top-notch control environment. As Manager of the Group Accounting & Controlling team, you will be co-owner of building and organizing processes for the annual accounting and taxation timeline, optimizing reporting processes, ensuring transparency and workflows. Additionally, you will work "hands-on" with consolidation and reporting to group stakeholders. You will visit foreign subsidiaries to optimize processes and workflows, and there will most likely be 5-10 travel days annually. It is important that you can manage projects and you will refer directly to Unifeeder's Head of Group Accounting & Controlling.

Business-oriented Manager with a focus on development
In order to be successful in this role, you must thrive in a busy work environment and have a passion for projects and carrying out change. You hold a cand.merc.aud. or a corresponding master’s degree in the field of accounting and a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience with auditing or accounting, controlling and consolidation in a larger international organization. Furthermore, you have a business-oriented and analytical mindset. You are experienced in Excel and general IT programs. You master Danish and English written and verbally at a professional level and have experience with IFRS.

Unifeeder
Unifeeder Group is a dynamic logistics company, covering Europe, the Middle East, Asia and the Wider Indian Subcontinent. They operate more than 150 vessels and make the way for +5,2 Mio. containers every year.

Unifeeder simplifies the complex tasks of choosing and managing supply chains by providing efficient and sustainable transport solutions. By expanding the network, coming up with innovative solutions and being agile in day-to-day operations, they enable their customers to concentrate on their core business while Unifeeder makes their cargo flow.

As a key player in global and regional supply chains, they recognize their environmental responsibilities and are committed to contributing to the reduction of local, national & global emissions.

The recruitment is handled by betterpeople A/S
The position is to be filled as soon as possible, and we will be processing applications continuously. However, we are willing to wait for the right candidate. If you have any questions, please contact Sine Fæste at e-mail sfm@betterpeople.dk. All applications are handled confidentially and with discretion. With reference to the GDPR regulations, applications are ONLY received through the link on our website. If you cannot upload your application through this link, please contact us.

PLEASE NOTE: Our job advertisement is automatically and continuously renewed on job portals until the position is filled. A renewal of the job advertisement is not an expression of a reposting, although it may appear so.

(C) betterpeople A/S
